results.title: Blowgun
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indians of the Orinoco: the Makiritare”.
Explains that in a single day a Makiritare craftsman tailors a blowgun with precision fittings that will last for years. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Bernstein on Beethoven: a tribute
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Burton, Amberson Productions and CBS
results.brief_description: Leonard Bernstein traces the life of Beethoven and plays sections from the “Piano Concerto No.1 in C Major” in a musical celebration of Beethoven’s Bicentennary at the Vienna Festival of Music. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Art of the sixties
results.creator_credit: Merrill Brockway, Bailey Film Productions and WCBS-TV
results.brief_description: This film documents the major directions in modern American art during the first seven years of the 1960’s. The keynote is that the artist has expanded the realm of art from the two-dimensional picture frame, climaxed by the artists of the 40’s and early 50’s, merged colour with sculpture, and sought out modern media to produce the characteristic wide spectrum of interests, ideas and products in the art of our time. The works of about 15 artists are represented, including George Segal’s life-size plaster representational figures, Klaus Oldenburg’s monumental Pop works, Donald Judd’s hard-edge two and three-dimensional paintings and Robert Rauschenberg’s three-dimensional objects in motion. The narrator discusses the collaboration between the artist and the modern industrial craftsman in certain complex works. The interesting focus on environmental art which has brought art beyond the third dimension is exemplified by several artists working together on “happenings”; by the sound and motion production models for the future by Len Lye, and by Les Levine’s work with Mylar, light and air. Narrated by Leonard Harris. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Merrill Brockway, Bailey Film Productions and WCBS-TV

results.title: Wild science
results.creator_credit: Chuck Barbee, Sheldon Fay Jr and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Actor Peter Falk talks of science’s newest and most controversial frontier: phenomena that seem to exist, yet cannot be tested or explained by scientific method.

results.title: The Moon: a giant step in geology
results.brief_description: Documentation of the first lunar landing and rock samples brought back by astronauts that have unlocked many mysteries of moon geology. Animated segments illustrate the origins of lunar topography. Other segments provide clues to the origin of the earth.

results.title: Learning about light. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A series of demonstrations reveal the properties that enabled man to harness light to his needs. The experiments illustrate the way light moves, is refracted and how a prism separates light into the spectrum of colours. Ends with a look at recent technological advances, in particular the laser. Suitable for upper primary science.

results.title: Culture and costumes: the great clothes put on
results.creator_credit: Randolph Hobler, John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents clothing as a phenomenon unique to humans in the animal kingdom. The functional aspect has led to innovation in fashion in many cultures and throughout history.

results.title: Laxton
results.creator_credit: AVC Productions and University of Hull
results.brief_description: The story of Laxton, a village in Nottinghamshire, and its evolution from Norman times, showing how strip farming operated. Shows how a medieval management system fits into the modern agricultural scene. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Arab-Israeli conflict
results.brief_description: An impartial analysis of the political and teeritorial problems of the Israelis and the Arabs with the differences being traced back to Abraham. Key areas in the disputes are indicated with maps. No other credits available. Suitable for Upper Secondary students.

results.title: Picnic with Weismann = Picknick mit Weismann
results.creator_credit: Jan Svankmajer, A H Puluj and ACI Films
results.brief_description: An unusual, surrealistic recounting of a day’s outing. Inanimate objects (a man’s suit, a trowel, charis, an old gramophone) take on a life of their own. A wardrobe opens and a man, bound and gagged falls into a prepared grave.
